Docs.summary: Used to provide design-time support in a visual designer for the Web server control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface. When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page.
## Examples This section provides two code examples. The first demonstrates how to extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ButtonDesigner> class. The second demonstrates how to extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button> class and associate it with the class that is created in the first code example.
The following code example shows how to create a custom designer class that extends the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ButtonDesigner> class and overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ButtonDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> property has not been set previously (that is, it has the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle.NotSet> field value), a call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ButtonDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method sets it to a blue-dashed border with a width of three pixels, and then displays that border on the design surface. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> property has been set, the existing border property values are displayed.
Typically, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ButtonDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> calls its base method, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>, which calls into the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.RenderControl%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method of the associated control to generate the markup.
[!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls_ButtonDesignerSamples#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls_ButtonDesignerSamples/VB/custombutton.vb#1)]
The following code example shows how to use a simple class that extends the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button> class and is associated with the `SampleButtonDesigner` class, created in the preceding example, through the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute> object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ButtonDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method replaces the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button.Text%2A> property with the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button> control if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button.Text%2A> contains no displayable characters. Then, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ButtonDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method calls its base method, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>, which calls into the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.RenderControl%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to generate the markup.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ButtonDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to change the generated markup.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> property has not been set previously (that is, it has the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle.NotSet> field value), a call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ButtonDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method sets it to a blue-dashed border with a width of three pixels, and then displays that border on the design surface. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> property has been set, the existing border property values are displayed.
Typically, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ButtonDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> calls its base method, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>, which calls into the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.RenderControl%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method of the associated control to generate the markup.
[!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls_ButtonDesignerSamples#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls_ButtonDesignerSamples/VB/custombutton.vb#1)]

block.para: If you are overriding the method, typically you will modify selected property values, then call the base method to generate the markup, and then restore the properties to their original values.
